children.name: toDataURL
children.description: Creates an Excel file that represents the current workbook and returns it as a data URL.

children.name: sheets.title
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use [name](#configuration-sheets.name) instead.

children.name: sheets.rows.height
children.description: The row height in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.index
Example - set row height by index

children.description: The zero-based index of the row in the sheet.Defaults to the index of the object in the array.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.value
children.description: The value of the cell. Numbers and dates will be formatted as strings. String values are HTML encoded.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.verticalAlign
children.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the cell value. Supported values are `"top"`, `"center"` and `"bottom"`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.vAlign
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use [verticalAlign](#configuration-sheets.rows.cells.verticalAlign) instead.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.wrap
Example - make the cell text underline

children.description: Setting it to `true` wraps the cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.underline
Example - make the cell text underline

children.description: Setting it to `true` underlines the cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.textAlign
children.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the cell value. Supported values are `"left"`, `"center"` and `"right"`.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.rowSpan
Example - make a cell span over two rows

children.description: Sets the number of rows that a cell occupies.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.italic
Example - make the cell text italic

children.description: Setting it to `true` italicizes the cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.index
children.description: The zero-based index of the cell in the row.> Only the first value will be recorded if two cells occupy the same index.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.hAlign
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use [textAlign](#configuration-sheets.rows.cells.textAlign) instead.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.formula
children.description: Sets the formula that Excel uses to compute and display the cell value

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.format
children.description: Sets the format that Excel uses to display the cell value.> The format option does not follow the `{0:}` syntax that `kendo.format` uses.The [Create a custom number format](https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Create-or-delete-a-custom-number-format-78f2a361-936b-4c03-8772-09fab54be7f4?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US) page describes the formats that Excel supports.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.fontSize
children.description: Sets the font size in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.fontName
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use [fontFamily](#configuration-sheets.rows.cells.fontFamily) instead.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.fontFamily
children.description: Sets the font used to display the cell value.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.colSpan
Example - make a cell span over two columns

children.description: Sets the number of columns that a cell occupies.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.color
Example - set the cell text color

children.description: The text color of the cell. Supports hex CSS-like values that start with "#" e.g. "#ff00ff".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.bold
Example - make the cell text bold

children.description: Setting it to `true` makes the cell value bold.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight.color
children.description: The right border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderRight
children.description: The style information for the right border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop.color
children.description: The top border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderTop
children.description: The style information for the top border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft.color
children.description: The left border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderLeft
children.description: The style information for the left border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom.size
children.description: The width of the border in pixels.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom.color
children.description: The bottom border color of the cell.Many standard CSS formats are supported, but the canonical form is "#ccff00".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.borderBottom
children.description: The style information for the bottom border of the cell.

children.name: sheets.rows.cells.background
Example - set the cell background color

children.description: Sets the background color of the cell. Supports hex CSS-like values that start with "#" e.g. "#ff00ff".

children.name: sheets.rows.cells
children.description: The cells of the every row. Each cell represents a cell from the final Excel document.

children.name: sheets.rows
Example - specify the rows of the sheet

children.description: The array of rows of the sheet.

children.name: sheets.name
children.description: Sets the name of the exported workbook sheet.

children.name: sheets.filter.to
children.description: The index of the last filterable column.

children.name: sheets.filter.from
children.description: The index of the first filterable column.

children.name: sheets.filter
children.description: Excel auto filter configuration. When set the final document will have auto filtering enabled.

children.name: sheets.frozenRows
children.description: The number of frozen rows in this sheet.

children.name: sheets.frozenColumns
children.description: The number of frozen columns in this sheet.

children.name: sheets.freezePane.rowSplit
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use[frozenRows](#configuration-sheets.frozenRows) instead.

children.name: sheets.freezePane.colSplit
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use[frozenColumns](#configuration-sheets.frozenColumns) instead.

children.name: sheets.freezePane
children.description: Deprecated in versions 2015.3 and newer. Use[frozenColumns](#configuration-sheets.frozenColumns) and[frozenRows](#configuration-sheets.frozenRows) instead.

children.name: sheets.columns.width
children.description: The width of the column in pixels.

children.name: sheets.columns.index
Example - set width on second column

children.description: The zero-based index of the column in the sheet.Defaults to the index of the object in the array.

children.name: sheets.columns.autoWidth
children.description: If set to true the column will stretch to fit the contents of all cells.

children.name: sheets.columns
children.description: The column configuration.

children.name: sheets
children.description: The sheets of the workbook. Every sheet represents a page from the final Excel file.

children.name: date
children.description: The date when the workbook is created. The default value is `new Date()`.

children.name: creator
children.description: The creator of the workbook.
